intro: Tetratheca calva var. pulchella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, such as heathlands and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
